meanings.definition: One tenth of annual produce or earnings, formerly taken as a tax for the support of the church and clergy.
meanings.sent1: The farmer donated a tithe of his crops to the church.
meanings.sent2: In the past, people would give a tithe to support the church.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel decided to tithe a portion of its acorn stash to the bird feeder.
meanings.sent4: The tithe of sunlight that reached the forest floor was just enough for the flowers to bloom.
meanings.sent5: The concept of tithe has been practiced for centuries as a way to give back to the community.

meanings.definition: To pay or give a tenth part of (one's income, property, etc.) as a tax or contribution to the church.
meanings.sent1: Every year, the family would tithe a portion of their earnings to the church.
meanings.sent2: It is important to tithe regularly to support the church's activities.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to tithe some of its treats to the dog, but ended up eating them all.
meanings.sent4: She felt like she had to tithe her time to work, leaving little for herself.
meanings.sent5: The river seemed to tithe its water to the thirsty land, nourishing the crops along its banks.
